content: What happened? (Good job with your English!) However, it would be more natural to say "What's going on?" or "What happened?" instead of "What happened?" which could come across as abrupt. A recommended word to learn is "natural".

I think what you're trying to say is "Eso, eso, eso, probando". But just to clarify, your sentence doesn't really make sense in either language. If you intended to say something else, feel free to share and I can help you correct it. Also, remember that in English, we typically use complete sentences rather than just two or three words. A recommended word to learn is "clarify".
